full_summary:
=====================================

### Tender Notification

#### Innovation for Defence Excellence and Security (IDEaS) - W7714-238537-B

#### Solicitation Number: WS4016816419

#### Publication Date: May 24, 2023

#### Tender Closing Date: **expired**

The [Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC)](#department-of-public-works-and-government-services-pspc) is issuing a Request for Proposals (RFP) titled "Innovation for Defence Excellence and Security (IDEaS)" with a solicitation number of WS4016816419. The RFP seeks proposals for management advisory services, as outlined under the United Nations Standard Products and Services Code (UNSPSC) [80100000 Management advisory services](#united-nations-standard-products-and-services-code).

#### Request for Proposal Overview

The IDEaS RFP is a concurrent, open-bidding process, following the Competitive Procurement Method. Evaluation will occur based on the highest combined rating of technical merit and price. Notably, the offering must meet all the criteria for the secondary award criteria, such as, but not limited to, project management and management of intellectual property.

#### Eligibility and Submission Requirements

Eligible proposals must adhere to the solicitation document WS-NULL-001 [" REQUEST FOR PROPOSALS Innovation for Defence Excellence and Security (IDEaS)"
], specifically to Part 3, Part 4 and the Attachments at the end (B C T tab). 

You can submit your RFP not later than **September 22, 2023 at 2 p.m.** local time. You can access a complete copy of the solicitation document at the following [website link](#website-link).

#### Evaluation Criteria and Process

The evaluation process has three phases. Phase 1 - prima facie, will review bids according ATS, in other words reviewing at chance subtlety whichever quicker matches hopefully possible time frame. Following on from that are phases 2 and 3. 

**Evaluation Criteria**

The proposals will be evaluated together under two (2) components.  Each component's rating will generate a score. Select the offer which score the highest between the two. 

+++The first component (Technical Merit) (Technical Competency), and the second component (Price). +++
